review_title: Good opportunity for temporary teachers, but not great as a long-term prospect
pros:
- Offer $ additional opportunities beyond the classroom (e.g., you can sign up to evaluate prospective students, etc.)
- Help with visa process
- Usually rather accommodating of what ESL levels and/or age groups you want to teach
- Contract position for 3-4 cycles (~9-12 months) with ability to extend for as long as you want
- Material is given to you (i.e., tests and books that you have to follow), but you have the freedom of planning the activities you want inside the classroom
cons:
- At the time (2017-2018), help in visa process was not fully fleshed out, so I ended up providing some documentation/guides myself to them that hopefully helped future teachers
- Salary is OK for the area/job, but definitely not high, with little in place for growth after ~a year of being there

review_title: Alright, but don't depend on it for your sole income
pros: CEDEI is overall a decent company to work for. They offer remote online teaching work and in person classes as well as volunteer visa sponsorship. Basic health insurance is also provided if you are in Ecuador.
cons: The only problem is that some teaching cycles, they don't give you a lot of classes and they require a minimum of 2 classes per cycle, so plan whatever other work you require around this requirement.

job_title: English As A Second Language Teacher in Cuenca
pros: A good school  for a newbie to get some experience.
cons: The school only cares about the money. The rules there are inconsistent. It's all about what the students want.  Teachers are either recycled or they quit after 10 weeks or the second semester.

* Relatively low pay;
